intro: Gomphandra petelotii, commonly known as the Madagascar starling tree, is a rare and unique plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees, and is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, and its fruits are small, fleshy drupes that contain a single seed. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Gomphandra petelotii is considered a critically endangered species.
